turns.user: Plan a 6-day cherry blossom trip to Tokyo and Kyoto from San Francisco for 2 people, March 25, budget $3500 per person. We love food and culture with a moderate pace.
turns.output:
# ğŸŒ¸ 6-Day Cherry Blossom Adventure: Tokyo & Kyoto  
From San Francisco â€¢ March 25â€“31, 2026 â€¢ 2 travelers â€¢ ~$3,500 per person

Youâ€™ve picked an excellent timeâ€”late March is prime sakura season in Tokyo and often good for early blossoms in Kyoto, with a nice balance of food, culture, and mild weather. Iâ€™ll outline a full 6-day plan (not counting your flight time in/out) at a moderate pace, focused on great food and rich cultural experiences.

---

## âœˆï¸ Trip Snapshot

- **Origin:** San Francisco  
- **Destinations:** Tokyo & Kyoto  
- **Dates:** March 25â€“31, 2026 (6 days on the ground)  
- **Travelers:** 2  
- **Budget:** ~$7,000 total (~$3,500 per person)  
- **Style:** Food-focused, cultural, moderate pace, cherry blossoms

> ğŸ’¡ Visa note: If you hold a U.S. passport, short-term tourism in Japan is typically visa-free, but always confirm current entry rules with official government sources before booking.

---

## ğŸ’° Budget Overview (Approximate, for 2 people)

| Category              | Estimate (Total for 2) |
|-----------------------|------------------------|
| Flights SFOâ€“Tokyo RT  | $2,000â€“2,400          |
| Intercity (Tokyoâ€“Kyoto Shinkansen RT) | $450â€“550 |
| Lodging (6 nights, midrange) | $1,200â€“1,600 |
| Food & Drinks         | $1,000â€“1,200          |
| Local Transport       | $200â€“250              |
| Activities & Entries  | $300â€“400              |
| Shopping/Misc         | $300â€“400              |
| **Total**             | **~$5,450â€“6,800**     |

Youâ€™re comfortably within **$7,000** for two with room for a splurge meal or extra experiences.

---

## ğŸ¨ Suggested Base

- **Tokyo (Nights 1â€“3 & 5â€“6):**  
  - Areas: **Shinjuku**, **Shibuya**, or **Tokyo Station** (great transit + food).  
  - Budget: ~$180â€“250/night for a clean 3â€“4â˜… hotel.
- **Kyoto (Night 4):**  
  - Areas: **Gion** or near **Kyoto Station**.  
  - Budget: ~$180â€“230/night; consider 1 night in a **ryokan** with breakfast.

---

## ğŸ—“ï¸ Day-by-Day Itinerary

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 1 â€“ Arrival & First Taste of Tokyo (Shinjuku & Shibuya)

**Morning / Midday â€“ Arrival**

- Land at **Tokyo Haneda (preferred)** or Narita.  
- Take **Limousine Bus** or **train** to your hotel in Shinjuku/Shibuya.  
  - Cost: ~$12â€“30 per person depending on airport and mode.  
- Check in, freshen up, short rest.

**Afternoon â€“ Shinjuku Gyoen & Sakura Stroll**

- Head to **Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden** â€“ one of Tokyoâ€™s top cherry blossom spots.  
  - Time: 2â€“3 hours.  
  - Cost: ~Â¥500/person (~$3.50).  
- Stroll the different garden areas (Japanese, French, English) and enjoy hanami-style wandering (no big picnics allowed, but great for photos).

**Evening â€“ Neon & Izakaya in Shinjuku**

- Walk through **Omoide Yokocho** and **Kabukicho** for classic neon cityscapes.  
- Dinner at a cozy **izakaya** in Omoide Yokocho or near Shinjuku Station:  
  - Try yakitori, karaage, sake, and seasonal dishes.  
  - Budget: Â¥3,000â€“4,000/person (~$20â€“30).  
- Optional: **Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building** free observation deck for night views.

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Cherry trees reflected in the ponds at Shinjuku Gyoen + Shinjukuâ€™s neon from a side street.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Buy a **Suica/PASMO** transit card (or use mobile equivalent) on arrival to tap in/out of trains and buses easily.

---

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 2 â€“ Classic Tokyo: Asakusa, Ueno & Yanaka

**Morning â€“ Asakusa & Senso-ji**

- Head to **Asakusa** (Tokyo Metro Ginza Line or Toei Asakusa Line).  
- Visit **Senso-ji Temple**, Nakamise shopping street for snacks and souvenirs.  
- Try street eats: ningyo-yaki (little cakes), melonpan, dango.  
- Time: 2â€“3 hours.

**Lunch**

- Eat at a local **tempura** or **soba** restaurant in Asakusa.  
  - Budget: Â¥1,200â€“2,000/person (~$8â€“14).

**Afternoon â€“ Ueno Park & Yanaka Ginza**

- Walk or take a short train to **Ueno Park**, another major sakura spot with rows of cherry trees.  
  - Optional: **Tokyo National Museum** or **National Museum of Western Art**.  
  - Museum entry: ~Â¥1,000â€“1,500/person (~$7â€“10).  
- Later, wander to **Yanaka Ginza**, an old-school shopping street with a nostalgic vibe.  
  - Great for small snacks, coffee, and people-watching.

**Evening â€“ Dinner in Ueno or Akihabara**

- Dinner in **Ueno** (izakaya or ramen) or hop to **Akihabara** for a quick look at anime/game culture.  
  - Budget: Â¥2,000â€“3,000/person (~$14â€“22).  

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Cherry blossom tunnel in Ueno Park + lanterns at Senso-ji at dusk.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Many small shops and temples accept **cash only**; withdraw some yen at 7-Eleven ATMs.

---

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 3 â€“ Modern Tokyo: Shibuya, Harajuku & Meiji Shrine

**Morning â€“ Meiji Shrine & Harajuku**

- Start at **Meiji Jingu** (Meiji Shrine), a peaceful Shinto shrine in a forested park.  
  - Time: ~1.5â€“2 hours.  
- Walk to **Harajuku / Takeshita Street** for youth fashion, crepes, and quirky shops.

**Lunch**

- Lunch in Harajuku:  
  - Options: trendy cafÃ©s, tonkatsu, or curry.  
  - Budget: Â¥1,500â€“2,000/person (~$10â€“14).

**Afternoon â€“ Omotesando & Shibuya Sky**

- Stroll **Omotesando** (tree-lined avenue with stylish architecture and cafÃ©s).  
- Head to **Shibuya**:  
  - Explore **Shibuya Crossing**, Hachiko statue, and shopping streets.  
  - Consider **Shibuya Sky** observation deck for panoramic city views.  
  - Shibuya Sky: ~Â¥2,000â€“2,500/person (~$14â€“18).

**Evening â€“ Foodie Night in Shibuya**

- Dinner at a **yakitori** or **izakaya** spot in Shibuya, or try a ramen shop like Ichiran or Afuri.  
  - Budget: Â¥2,000â€“3,000/person (~$14â€“22).  
- Optional: craft cocktails at a small bar or a sake tasting bar.

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Shibuya Crossing from an elevated viewpoint + torii gate at Meiji Shrine.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: For popular spots like Shibuya Sky, **reserve tickets online** in advance to avoid long waits.

---

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 4 â€“ Kyoto Temples, Gion & Traditional Streets

**Morning â€“ Shinkansen to Kyoto**

- Check out early and take the **Tokaido Shinkansen** from Tokyo Station or Shinagawa to **Kyoto Station**.  
  - Time: ~2.5 hours (Nozomi).  
  - Cost: ~Â¥14,000â€“15,000/person round trip (~$100â€“110 each way, depending on seat).  
- Drop bags at your Kyoto hotel (Gion or near Kyoto Station).

**Late Morning / Early Afternoon â€“ Fushimi Inari Taisha**

- Head to **Fushimi Inari Shrine** (JR Nara Line or Keihan Line).  
  - Walk through the thousands of vermilion torii gates.  
  - Time: 2â€“3 hours (you can do a partial hike for a moderate pace).  
  - Cost: Free.

**Lunch**

- Eat near Fushimi Inari: kitsune udon, inari sushi, or local specialties.  
  - Budget: Â¥1,200â€“1,800/person (~$8â€“13).

**Afternoon â€“ Higashiyama & Kiyomizu-dera**

- Explore **Higashiyama district**: Ninen-zaka, Sannen-zaka, traditional wooden streets.  
- Visit **Kiyomizu-dera Temple** for sweeping city views and seasonal blossoms.  
  - Entry: ~Â¥400â€“500/person (~$3â€“4).  
  - Time: 2â€“3 hours.

**Evening â€“ Gion & Kaiseki / Izakaya Dinner**

- Stroll **Gion** in the early evening; you may spot geiko/maiko on their way to appointments (be respectful, no flash photography in faces).  
- Dinner options:  
  - **Casual kaiseki-style** or multi-course seasonal meal (splurge: Â¥8,000â€“12,000/person).  
  - Or a more modest **izakaya** with Kyoto-style dishes (Â¥3,000â€“4,000/person).

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Kiyomizu-deraâ€™s wooden stage at sunset + lantern-lit alleys of Gion.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Kyoto can be busy in blossom seasonâ€”**book your hotel and any special dinner** as early as possible.

---

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 5 â€“ Arashiyama Morning, Back to Tokyo Evening

**Morning â€“ Arashiyama (Bamboo Grove & River)**

- Take JR or local train to **Arashiyama**.  
- Visit the **Bamboo Grove**, **Tenryu-ji Temple** gardens, and stroll by the **Katsura River**.  
  - Tenryu-ji: ~Â¥500â€“800/person (~$3â€“6).  
- If blossoms are good, the riverside and nearby parks are beautiful.

**Lunch**

- Lunch in Arashiyama: tofu cuisine, soba, or cafÃ© with river views.  
  - Budget: Â¥1,500â€“2,000/person (~$10â€“14).

**Afternoon â€“ Return to Tokyo**

- Head back to your hotel, pick up luggage, and take the **Shinkansen back to Tokyo**.  
- Check into your Tokyo hotel (if different from first stay).  
- Short rest.

**Evening â€“ Relaxed Tokyo Neighborhood Dinner**

- Choose a slightly quieter area for dinner: **Kagurazaka**, **Nakameguro** (great sakura along the canal if timing is right), or back to Shinjuku/Shibuya.  
  - Budget: Â¥2,000â€“3,000/person (~$14â€“22).  

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove early in the morning + Nakameguro canal if blossoms are out.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: For Shinkansen, reserve **seats on the right side** Tokyoâ†’Kyoto and left side Kyotoâ†’Tokyo for possible Mt. Fuji views (weather permitting).

---

### ğŸŒ¸ Day 6 â€“ Free-Choice Tokyo + Last-Minute Shopping

**Morning â€“ Choose Your Vibe**

Pick 1â€“2 based on your interests and energy:

- **Odaiba**: Futuristic bay area, teamLab Planets (immersive digital art), shopping.  
- **Tsukiji Outer Market**: Food stalls, sushi, kitchenware.  
- **Kichijoji & Inokashira Park**: Chill neighborhood + park with possible cherry blossoms.

**Lunch**

- If at Tsukiji: fresh sushi or donburi.  
  - Budget: Â¥2,000â€“3,000/person (~$14â€“22).  
- Elsewhere: ramen, curry, or cafÃ© lunch.

**Afternoon â€“ Shopping & Packing**

- Last-minute shopping in **Tokyo Station**, **Ginza**, or **Shibuya**:  
  - Souvenirs, snacks, matcha, ceramics, stationery.  
- Return to hotel to pack and rest.

**Evening â€“ Farewell Dinner**

- Splurge on a **special final meal**:  
  - Sushi omakase (midrange), yakiniku, or upscale izakaya.  
  - Budget: Â¥6,000â€“10,000/person (~$40â€“70) depending on level.  
- Early night if you have a morning flight; otherwise enjoy one last stroll.

> ğŸ“¸ Photo spot: Tokyo Station Marunouchi side at night or Ginzaâ€™s lit-up streets.  
> ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Use up remaining Suica/PASMO balance on small purchases or keep it for a future Japan trip (cards stay valid for years).

---

## âœ… Pre-Trip Checklist

- [ ] Book **flights SFOâ€“Tokyo** (aim for Haneda if possible).  
- [ ] Reserve **hotels** in Tokyo (4 nights total) and Kyoto (1 night; consider ryokan).  
- [ ] Buy/reserve **Shinkansen tickets** Tokyoâ€“Kyotoâ€“Tokyo (seat reservations).  
- [ ] Arrange **eSIM or pocket Wiâ€‘Fi** for constant data.  
- [ ] Check **passport validity** (at least 6 months beyond return date).  
- [ ] Confirm **entry rules/visa** and any health requirements for Japan.  
- [ ] Reserve **Shibuya Sky**, teamLab, or any special restaurants in advance.

If youâ€™d like, I can next:  
- Suggest **specific hotel names** in your budget in Shinjuku/Shibuya and Kyoto, or  
- Help you **fine-tune** this plan (e.g., slower pace, more food tours, or more time in Kyoto).

## ğŸ—“ï¸ Day 3 â€“ Montmartre, SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur & Bistros
